repository.corpname: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation & Archives

did.abstract: Two typsescript speeches by Edward A. Filene.

defitem.label: Contact Information:
defitem.item: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives Martin P. Catherwood Library 227 Ives Hall Cornell University Ithaca, NY 14853 (607) 255-3183 kheel_center@cornell.edu http://www.ilr.cornell.edu/library/kheel-center

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of two speeches given by Edward Filene. "Why Men Strike" was an address to the Economic Club on New York, delivered on Wednesday, May 3, 1922. "Labor and the N.R.A." was read for radio broadcast on Tuesday, October 10, 1933.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Edward A. Filene Addresses #5451m. Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Edward Albert Filene (September 3, 1860 - September 26, 1937) was an American businessman and philanthropist. He is best known for building the Filene's department store chain and for his decisive role in pioneering credit unions across the United States.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: "Why Men Strike," 9 pages, 1922; "Labor and the N.R.A.," 10 pages, 1933.
